abstract.text: Creates a virtual source in a client.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The client to own the virtual source.
The name of the virtual source.
The MIDI protocol variant to send from this source. The system automatically converts messages from this protocol to the protocol of the destination.
On successful return, a pointer to the newly created source.
Drivers don’t need to call this function. When they create devices and entities, the system automatically creates sources and destinations at that time. After creating a virtual source, use
to transmit MIDI messages from your virtual source to any clients connected to the virtual source.
After creating a virtual source, assign it the same unique ID it had the last time your app created it. Doing so permits other clients to retain persistent references to your virtual source.

abstract.text: Communicate with MIDI devices such as hardware keyboards and synthesizers.
An object that maintains per-client state.
Creates a virtual destination in a client.
Disposes of a virtual source or destination.
Returns contextual data assigned to an endpoint.
A MIDI source or destination an entity owns.
Sets contextual data on an endpoint.
Returns a destination in the system.
Returns the number of destinations in the system.
Returns the number of sources in the system.
Returns a source in the system.
Distributes incoming MIDI events from a source to its connected client input ports.
Creates a virtual source in a client.
A reference to a CFString object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.

inlineContent.text: The client to own the virtual source.
The name of the virtual source.
The MIDI protocol variant to send from this source. The system automatically converts messages from this protocol to the protocol of the destination.
On successful return, a pointer to the newly created source.
